title: Express Talk: Porcelain in East-West Encounters
hero_caption: <p>Porcelain: China, Ming dynasty (1368-1644), Mounts: England, London, c. 1610. <em>Ewer</em>, c. 1610. Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Medard W. Welch.&nbsp;</p>
description:
Explore how cross-cultural endeavors between East and West contributed to changes in the look and function of decorative objects. Join Curatorial fellow Xi Cecilia Zhang for this focus on a 17th century blue-and-white Chinese porcelain.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
